We spend a lot of time indoors with a yo: We spend a lot of time indoors with a young baby, and Covid-19 makes it much more intense. It is completely normal to feel isolated, overwhelmed, anxious, and scared for you and your baby.
Use social media, phone calls, and anyth: Use social media, phone calls, and anything at your disposal to reach out and connect with others.
Take turns with others to care for your: Take turns with others to care for your baby. Take time for YOU.
Sleep when your baby sleeps so you have: Sleep when your baby sleeps so you have energy.
Follow your baby’s lead by copying or mi: Follow your baby’s lead by copying or mirroring.
Repeat and react to their babble or word: Repeat and react to their babble or words.
Use your child’s name when you speak to: Use your child’s name when you speak to your baby.
Use words to describe what your baby is: Use words to describe what your baby is doing.
Let your baby explore the world through: Let your baby explore the world through the 5 senses!
Get to your baby’s level and make sure t: Get to your baby’s level and make sure they can see and hear you.
Play peek-a-boo, sing songs or lullabies: Play peek-a-boo, sing songs or lullabies, stack blocks or cups
Make music together: banging on pots, pl: Make music together: banging on pots, playing with rattlers, shaking jars with beans.
Share books together - even at a very ea: Share books together - even at a very early age! Describe what is happening in the pictures. Let your baby explore books with all of the senses.
Be gentle with your children as they lea: Be gentle with your children as they learn, but also with yourself as the parent!
Just because something didn’t go well to: Just because something didn’t go well today, or you lost your temper, this doesn’t define who you are as a parent. Remind yourself of the things you did well today, even if they may seem small.
Check to see what is making your baby cr: Check to see what is making your baby cry.
Swaddling or gently rocking can help cal: Swaddling or gently rocking can help calm your baby.
Singing a lullaby or playing soft music: Singing a lullaby or playing soft music can be soothing.
Keep calm and take a break! You can plac: Keep calm and take a break! You can place your baby in a safe place on their back, and then walk away. Be sure to check on your baby every 5 to 10 minutes.
